sentences: Ta on oma saatusega juba leppinud.
context: Saatus is an Estonian noun that means 'destiny' or 'fate'. It refers to the course of a person's life and everything that happens in it, often conceived as being predetermined by some external power. The word can be used to describe various aspects of fate - whether tragic, harsh, merciless, or even fortunate. In its different grammatical forms, it can refer to one's destiny (saatus), of/for the destiny (saatuse), or destinies in plural form (saatused).
